definition: to be green with envy (neologism c. 2009)

sentences.english: It is the great who is assailed by envy.
sentences.chinese: 正是大人物才受到嫉妒的中伤。

sentences.english: Maaike tells me about her life. I am soon jealous.
sentences.chinese: 玛艾克则给我讲了她的生活，我听着听着就嫉妒了。

sentences.english: The doctors tell me that's what has knocked my digestion out being so infernally jealous of her.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说我消化不良就是因为我对她嫉妒得太厉害啦。

sentences.english: She admits other girls her age were jealous of her and would pick on her at school.
sentences.chinese: 她承认其他同龄女孩嫉妒她并在学校里作弄她。

sentences.english: If children live with jealousy, they learn what envy is.
sentences.chinese: 在嫉妒中成长的孩子，学会钩心斗角。

sentences.english: Inevitably, jealousy and desperation turn to enmity.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒和绝望不可避免的转化为敌意。

sentences.english: He was jealous of nobody's achievements.
sentences.chinese: 他不嫉妒任何人的成就。

sentences.english: Keep in mind, jealousy may pop up when you least expect it.
sentences.chinese: 记住，嫉妒感会在你最意想不到的时候窜出来。

sentences.english: I freely admit to being jealous of functions as first-class objects, for instance.
sentences.chinese: 我坦率承认，被嫉妒的职能一流的对象，例如。

sentences.english: Are you jealous of your classmates' success?
sentences.chinese: 你嫉妒旧日同窗的成功吗？

sentences.english: As iron is eaten away by rust , so the envious are consumed by their own passion.
sentences.chinese: 就像铁被锈腐蚀，嫉妒被本身的情感毁灭。

sentences.english: No4. Doubt and even get jealous of the achievements and honors others get.
sentences.chinese: 对别人取得的成绩和荣誉常常表示怀疑，甚至嫉妒。

sentences.english: We shouldn't blame, laugh at and envy anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应责怪，笑和嫉妒任何人。

sentences.english: They were divided by mutual suspicion and jealousies.
sentences.chinese: 他们因为相互猜疑嫉妒而不和。

sentences.english: A man driven by jealousy is capable of anything.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒心可以使人什么都做得出来。

sentences.english: The world should not be prejudiced and jealous.
sentences.chinese: 世界不应抱有偏见和嫉妒。

definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
